definitions.definition: Mental acceptance of a claim as true.
definitions.example: It's my belief that the thief is somebody known to us.

definitions.definition: Faith or trust in the reality of something; often based upon one's own reasoning, trust in a claim, desire of actuality, and/or evidence considered.
definitions.example: Based on this data, it is our belief that X does not occur.
The ancient people have a belief in many deities.

definitions.definition: The quality or state of believing.
definitions.example: My belief that it will rain tomorrow is strong.
She often said it was her belief that carried her through the hard times.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) One's religious or moral convictions.
definitions.example: I don't want to do a no-fault divorce on my husband and steal from him under color of law. It's against my beliefs.
